books.title: The Masqueraders
books.author: Georgette Heyer
books.summary: Two siblings, disguised as members of the opposite sex, navigate the intrigues of 18th-century London while falling in love with unsuspecting suitors.

books.title: The Square Emerald
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: Scotland Yard’s first female investigator sets out to prove the innocence of a convicted forger.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: English as She Is Spoke
books.author: Pedro Carolino
books.summary: A phrasebook of unintentionally hilarious English.

books.title: Henry VIII
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VIII plans to divorce his first wife for Anne Bullen.

books.title: Fifty-One Tales
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A series of otherworldly short stories ranging from the moral to the whimsical.

books.title: The Elusive Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A French official schemes to finally catch the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: At the Villa Rose
books.author: A. E. W. Mason
books.summary: A wealthy widow is murdered at her villa in Aix-les-Bains, and her companion is missing.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Theory of the Leisure Class
books.author: Thorstein Veblen
books.summary: Veblen outlines his theory of social stratification in an industrialized society, the paradoxical elevation of the leisure class, and conspicuous consumption.

books.title: A Cycle of the West
books.author: John G. Neihardt
books.summary: A series of epic poems that recounts the history, legends, and mythology of the American West.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: The Moon Maid
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young man travels to the moon with a group of companions and discovers that it’s inhabited; in subsequent centuries, reincarnations of the same man deal with an invasion of the Earth by the malevolent inhabitants of the Moon.

books.title: Lord Peter Views the Body
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: A collection of short stories in which an aristocratic amateur detective solves a variety of crimes.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
